author: .vbuterin
content: There are different constructions. I think in the one we are considering for the state, we're mandating a fixed length for keys, so that situation is impossible

author: .vbuterin
content: In the ethereum patricia tree, base-16 keys get converted into a base-17 form via attaching a G at the end (all digits except the last one can still only be 0...9A...F), so there's no possibility of prefixes

author: yperbasis
content: Currently (with the Merkle-Patricia trie) such collisions are impossible even for receipts and transactions roots because the keys there are RLP-serialized integers, which can't be prefixes of each other. In other words, the 17th branch element provisioned by the Yellow Paper never happens in reality for Ethereum.
